case_vignette: A 17-year-old girl comes to the physician because of a 2-day history of pain in her right knee. Last week she had right wrist pain. She has no history of recent trauma. She returned from summer camp in Connecticut 2 weeks ago. She is sexually active with one male partner and uses an oral contraceptive. Her temperature is 38°C (100.4°F). Examination shows several painless vesiculopustular lesions on the back and one lesion on the right sole of the foot. There is swelling of the right knee with tenderness to palpation. Passive extension of the right wrist and fingers elicits pain.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing pain in my right knee for the past two days and I also had pain in my right wrist last week.
Have you had any recent injuries or unusual physical activity?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or unusual physical activity.
Are there any signs of redness, swelling, or warmth in the affected knee or wrist?
My right knee is swollen and tender, but I didn't mention anything about redness or warmth.
Have you experienced any fever, chills, or other systemic symptoms recently?
Yes, I have a fever with a temperature of 38°C (100.4°F).
Do you have any pre-existing health conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
I'm not aware of any pre-existing health conditions, but I am currently using an oral contraceptive.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin, like rashes, or changes in the color of your body extremities?
Yes, I have several painless blister-like spots on my back and one on the right sole of my foot.
Is there any family history of arthritis, autoimmune diseases, or similar joint and skin-related conditions?
I didn't mention any family history of such conditions.
Have you been recently bitten by any insects such as ticks or had exposure to areas where such bites are common?
I returned from summer camp in Connecticut 2 weeks ago.
Have you experienced any stiffness in your joints, particularly in the morning or after periods of inactivity?
I didn't mention experiencing any stiffness in my joints.
Final Diagnosis: Lyme disease.
